meaningMnemonic: You <kanji>bury</kanji> things into people who look like they've <kanji>die</kanji>d. It's called <vocabulary>implantation</vocabulary>. They're not really dead though. This is surgery and they'll wake up and go about their lives with whatever that thing was that you put in them.
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You didn't learn this reading for 埋 yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

Wait that's not a person you're <vocabulary>embedding</vocabulary> things into. It's a bunch of <reading>mi</reading>ce (まい). I guess that's okay. Just don't go putting the mice into people. That's... don't cross that line.
